title: PHPutf8_encode()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPutf8_encode()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Encode an ISO-8859-1 string to UTF-8:
<?php
$text = "\xE0";
echo utf8_encode($text);
?>

Definition and Usage
The utf8_encode() function encodes an ISO-8859-1 string to UTF-8.
Unicode is a universal standard, and has been developed to describe all 
possible characters of all languages plus a lot of symbols with one unique 
number for each character/symbol.
However, it is not always possible to transfer a Unicode character to another 
computer reliably. UTF-8 has been developed to transfer a Unicode character from 
one computer to another.
Syntax
utf8_encode(string)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
string
Required. Specifies the ISO-8859-1 string to encode
Technical Details
Return Value:
The encoded string on success. FALSE on failure
PHP Version:
4.0+

★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPutf8_encode()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPutf8_encode()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples.
